str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A temple for (containing) an image (an idol). Neuter of a presumed derivative of eidolon; an image-fane.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as oikodome; to be a house-builder, i.e. Construct or confirm.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Strengthened for a primary edo; used only in certain tenses, the rest being supplied by phago; to eat.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a compound of eidolon and a presumed derivative of thuo; an image-sacrifice, i.e. Part of an idolatrous offering.
